item.description:
Let’s call this the After Picnic Party. You’re already downtown why not stay a while for drinking with cool people and, you know, pirate cruise on a 125-foot gaff-rigged schooner?!?

From the website:
Sail back in time as hilarious characters in colonial dress tell you the amazing story of how Rum helped to start the Revolution. They will have you singing sea shanty work songs and dancing the sailor’s hornpipe on the main deck with their fiddles and concertinas!
We will have revolutionary Rum and Wine drinks available for sale at the bar, including:
• Dark & Stormy
• Royal Navy Rum (Grog)
• Port
• Madeira


The cruise starts at 8:30pm so between the picnic and the cruise, the plan is to walk from the Common to the Harbor with a few stops along the way. The plan is:

Barracuda’s Tavern: 4:30-5:30
15 Bosworth St.

Black Rose: 5:30-6:30
160 State Street

Hong Kong at Faneuil Hall 6:30-8:00
65 Chatham St.

Then we’ll meet outside the Aquarium at 8pm.

Tickets for the cruise are $36.75 and drinks on-board are around $6.

For more information go to: http://www.libertyfleet.com/index.php?option=com_registrationpro&view=event&Itemid=0&did=1848
item.name: Pirate Harbor Cruise plus Bar Crawl
